Issues.Title: Fix CollectionEditor min/max
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix CollectionEditor min/max" (#944)

Issues.Title: Porting of PropertyGrid per-mon changes. Excluding System.Drawing nam…
Issues.Body:
Porting per-monitor DpiAwareness changes made for PropertyGrid in Desktop Framework. This PR does not include all the changes made in this regard but contain the fundamental support that was required to make property grid per-monitor aware. Excluded changes in this PR are from System.Drawing namespace 
 and are about scaling the editors. We should be able to scale them better. Not want to bring the old pattern to core. Also, we are not yet supporting per-monitor awareness in core.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Porting of PropertyGrid per-mon changes. Excluding System.Drawing nam…" (#943)

Issues.Title: port multiline string editor
Issues.Body:
Ported multi line string editor from framework to core. 

Contributes to #892.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "port multiline string editor" (#942)

Issues.Title: Addign missing Resources for System.Desing* namespace.
Issues.Body:
We started porting APIs from System.Design* name space as per the requests we received  since winforms become open source. However, we missed porting some of the resources. As part of this change, we are making following changes

- Porting the resources required for the source code that are already ported.

- Bitmap Icons/images are replaced with Icons. Corresponding source changes were in place.

- We are porting all the images, equivalent, to desktop framework. Even though,  we did not port all the source code that require/use these images. Replacing existing Bitmaps with Icons have a cross team dependency. hence, pushing all of them in one go hoping that we fill the gap in porting the source code between core and desktop framework.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Addign missing Resources for System.Desing* namespace." (#941)

Issues.Title: Make shell files in eng/common executable
Issues.Body:
In wpf/corefx etc. these have the executable flag enabled. Match that to reduce diffs if you copy eng/common from one library to another, for example.

In the second commit I've added a copy of `build.sh` to match wpf/corefx. Now I know that we're not really supposed to be building winforms on unix, but this is helpful for things like using vs code on mac :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Make shell files in eng/common executable" (#940)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove include file comments" (#938)

Issues.Title: Suggestion: run `dotnet  format` Over the whole codebase
Issues.Body:
`dotnet format` is a global tool that takes an editor config file and cleans up all the code to match the style.

Talking to some of y’all at build, i know that it’s been quite hard for the team to review cleanup prs as it’s hard to differentiate automated cleanup and manual cleanup. The former comes at little risk but the latter may be breaking if something goes wrong (and even if there’s one bug, things can still break!!)

I propose either getting the bot to run `DotNet format` (or I can do it) and submit either a big PR or something split up to fix this

Thoughts?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Suggestion: run `dotnet  format` Over the whole codebase" (#937)

Issues.Title: HeaderText cannot be gotten in DataGridColumnStyle class
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-Preview6-011777
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**MoreInfo:** This is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net Core 3.0 SDK Preview5 build
**Problem description:**
1. Open attached Winforms .Net Core app
[WindowsFormsApp6.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3151978/WindowsFormsApp6.zip)
2. Open Form1.cs file, and set breakpoint in following code:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/57291512-769c9000-7074-11e9-9952-c6034231dc9b.png)
3. Build and run this application to check **col** value

**Actual behavior:** 
There is an error for getting HeaderText property, see following screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/57291696-c67b5700-7074-11e9-9697-8a98140e1e39.png)

**Expected behavior:**
no error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/57291975-74870100-7075-11e9-9dd5-786f2fc8d634.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HeaderText cannot be gotten in DataGridColumnStyle class" (#934)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: ListBox items don't support the ScrollItem pattern
Issues.Body:
ListBox supports the Scroll pattern but ListBox items don't support ScrollItem pattern and don't have ScrollIntoView action.

**Expected result:**
ListBox items should support the ScrollItem pattern.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: ListBox items don't support the ScrollItem pattern" (#932)

Issues.Title: Increase code coverage
Issues.Body:
I didn't see an issue for this already (feel free to close if there is one). Looks like coverage is less than 30%.
```
@@                 Coverage Diff                 @@
##              master        #914         +/-   ##
===================================================
- Coverage   28.94861%   28.94235%   -0.00626%     
===================================================
  Files           1083        1083                 
  Lines         294135      294133          -2     
  Branches       38407       38407                 
===================================================
- Hits           85148       85129         -19     
- Misses        204950      204965         +15     
- Partials        4037        4039          +2
```

@hughbe you've spent more time looking at the code/tests than many of us, how feasible do you think it is to get this number up? That would help increase confidence in the upcoming release, for sure - and make refactors less risky.

I wonder if the debt could be categorized somehow eg by namespace to make this easier to drive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Increase code coverage" (#917)
